questions.title: Question 1 for Class 190925
questions.main: Storms that form in the tropics are given names when:
questions.answer: A) they reach tropical storm strength

mcq.option: A) they reach tropical storm strength
B) they become fully developed hurricanes
C) they approach to within 250 miles of land
D) rotation becomes visible on a satellite photograph

questions.title: Question 2 for Class 190925
questions.main: Hurricanes are given names when the storm is in what stage of development?
questions.answer: The name is assigned when the storm reaches tropical storm strength.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class 190925
questions.main: Just before a storm becomes a fully developed hurricane it is in the ____ stage.

mcq.option: A) tropical disturbance
B) tropical depression
C) tropical storm
D) cyclone
E) typhoon

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 190925
questions.main: Why are mid-latitude cyclonic storms called 'extratropical cyclones'?
questions.answer: A middle-latitude cyclonic storm is a storm that forms at middle and high latitudes outside of the tropics.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class 190925
questions.main: An intense storm of tropical origin that forms over the Pacific Ocean adjacent to the west coast of Mexico would be called a:

mcq.option: A) hurricane
B) typhoon
C) cyclone
D) willy willy
E) baguio

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 190925
questions.main: The term storm surge refers to:
questions.answer: C) a rise in ocean level of several meters or more

mcq.option: A) the leading edge of a hurricane
B) a higher-than-average incidence of tropical storm occurrence
C) a rise in ocean level of several meters or more
D) the increasing speed of a hurricane as it moves in the middle latitudes

questions.title: Question 7 for Class 190925
questions.main: The main reason hurricanes don't develop over the south Atlantic Ocean adjacent to South America is because:
questions.answer: C) the surface water temperatures are too cold

mcq.option: A) the Coriolis force is too small there
B) the pressure gradient force is too weak in that area
C) the surface water temperatures are too cold
D) the air at the surface is always diverging

questions.title: Question 8 for Class 190925
questions.main: What is the name given to a hurricane-like storm that forms over the western North Pacific Ocean?

questions.title: Question 9 for Class 190925
questions.answer: D) an enormous thunderstorm that lasts for several hours

mcq.option: A) a thunderstorm that produces several tornadoes
B) a thunderstorm that produces a category F-5 tornado
C) a thunderstorm with an extremely large downburst
D) an enormous thunderstorm that lasts for several hours

questions.title: Question 10 for Class 190925
questions.main: Explain how a storm surge forms. How does it inflict damage in hurricane-prone areas?
questions.answer: The combined effect of high water (which is usually well above the high-tide level) high winds and the net Ekman transport toward the coast produces the storm surge - an abnormal rise of several meters in the ocean level - which inundates low-lying areas and turns beachfront homes into piles of splinters. The storm surge is particularly damaging when it coincides with normal high tides.
